intro: Uragoga polyneura, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found growing in moist, shaded areas along stream banks and in forest understories. Uragoga polyneura plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
